article: How to Remove Scratches from a Car

steps.subtitle: You may need to do more than 1 application to get rid of surface scratches using toothpaste. Check the area to see if the scratches are still visible and then repeat the process 1 or 2 more times if needed.
sub-points: Make sure that you do not do more than 3 applications or you may damage the clear coat of the car’s paint.

points.name: Using a Scratch Removal Product for Small Scratches

steps.title: Repeat 2 to 3 times if needed.
steps.subtitle: Check the area to see if the scratches are still visible. If they are, then you can repeat the product application 2 to 3 times. Just be careful not to do this too many times or you may damage the clear coat on your car.
sub-points: Check the manufacturer’s instructions before proceeding with another application.

steps.title: Wax the area to seal the paint you have repaired.
steps.subtitle: Apply a high-quality carnauba  to the surface of your car and then buff the area with a buffer pad or microfiber cloth. You can purchase a waxing kit that includes everything you need to , such as the wax and a buffing pad or microfiber cloth.
sub-points: Apply a quarter-size amount of wax to the buffing pad or cloth to start and add more if needed.
Use circular motions and press down on the pad or cloth with medium pressure.
Keep going until the wax is evenly distributed and the car’s surface looks shiny.
